result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. McCormick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall have no contact with D.G., C.J.K,, and N.P.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain/maintain full time employment at the discretion of probation.  Defendant may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than April 26, 2017 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert J. McCormick in court with attorney David Deda.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Amended Information filed.   Plea of no contest to possession of narcotic drugs 961.41(3g)(am)   Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of the amended charge possession of narcotic drugs.  Court orders withheld sentence probation 3 years with conditions of court costs; 8 months county jail with huber to begin no later than April 26, 2017;  no contact with DG, CJK, and NP; AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; obtain/maintain full time employment at discretion of probation agent. Court did not order a DNA sample and surcharge as it was previously done in Price County.   28 days sentence credit.  May petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  - rt

for Robert Joseph Mccormick

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall have no contact with D.L.G. - dob: 8-14-1995; C.J.K. - dob: 12-7-1994 and N.L.P. - dob: 10-6-1996.
Initial Appearance on February 9, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert J. McCormick appears in court, in custody with Attorney Dave Deda, specially.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $5,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no contact with D.L.G. - dob:  8-14-95; C.J.K. - dob:  12-7-94 and N.L.P. - dob:  10-6-96.  Statement by Attorney Deda.  Court orders a $3,000.00 cash bond with the same conditions as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is February 9, 2016 at 2:00 pm.  - rt
